etymologies: early 20th century: named after Jules Léotard (1839–70), French trapeze artist

definitions: a close-fitting one-piece garment, made of a stretchy fabric, that covers a person's body from the shoulders to the top of the thighs and typically the arms, worn by dancers or people exercising indoors

examples.text: she worked out in her black leotard

shortDefinitions: close-fitting one-piece garment, made of stretchy fabric

definitions: close-fitting leggings or tights, especially those worn by dancers.
